verses.name: Proverbs 21:6
verses.text: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:7
verses.text: The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:8
verses.text: The way of man is froward and strange: but as for the pure, his work is right.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:9
verses.text: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman in a wide house.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:10
verses.text: The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.
